title: Boot usb without BIOS support (working solution)

forumNotes.author: guimenez
forumNotes.content:
Hi  

finally i found the solution to boot from usb without BIOS support and i want to share to everyone in this excellent forum.  

the program is plop bootmanager and its freeware, its very simple and boot for everthing you want.  
for simple use, just extract the folder plpbt-5.0.3.zip(this time) and use the plpbt.img and burn to a cd with any recording program that have the bootcd option.  

Then you just need to use the bootcd with the usb memory connected to computer and after cd booting it will appear a menu with some options, just select USB and then voila, you computer will boot from the usb flash drive.  

Now you can boot any usb that supports booting from any pc.  

hope it helps you like it helped me :smile:  

link: [http://www.plop.at/e...r.html#download](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanager.html#download "External link")
